title: Baxter International Shares Tumble on Accounting Investigation
text:
By Colin Kellaher

Shares of Baxter International Inc. (BAX) fell more than 9% on Thursday after the company said it had launched an internal investigation into misstatements involving foreign-exchange transactions.

The Deerfield, Ill., medical-products company said the transactions, which occurred between different parts of Baxter, were done to generate foreign-exchange gains or losses and used a method that didn't comply with generally accepted accounting principles.

Baxter said it has informed the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission of the investigation, which covers transactions dating back to at least 2014, and said it doesn't expect to file its third-quarter report with the agency on a timely basis.

Shares of Baxter were recently down 9.1%, to $79.96.
